p: The EOs of the RM guava variety showed the presence of D-limonene, α-pinene, globulol, and β-caryophyllene, and they are represented by 33.96, 20.58, 14.13, and 11.21%, respectively. In the EQ variety, the main compounds detected were β-caryophyllene, globulol, trans-nerolidol, and α-copaene, recorded at 43.20, 10.57, 9.03, and 6.71%, respectively ( Table 1). The EQ EO results were similar to the figures reported for the Pakistani variety [ 15]. According to these results, D-limonene and α-pinene might be assigned as a chemo-taxonomical fingerprint for the RM guava variety, while trans-nerolidol and α-copaene can be assigned for the EQ variety.
